column1: popculty 160582103304 "2017-05-12 11:22:32 GMT" http://popculty.tumblr.com/post/160582103304/luthorbitch-cvtgrant-cvtgrant-popculty "luthorbitch: cvtgrant:  cvtgrant:  popculty:  popculty:  Just a few articles i stumbled across  BUT WAITâ€“ THEREâ€™S MORE NOT TO MENTION MY PERSONAL FAVE: WITH DETAILS SUCH AS Thank you @99percentyou for doing the lordâ€™s work keeping track of all these.  More:  Why Mon-El Belongs in a Supporting Role on Supergirl - BuddyTV  Where Supergirl Went Wrong - Medium What Is Happening to the Relationships on Supergirl? - The Workprint  Supergirl Doesnâ€™t Care for Fibbing - TV Guide   8 Reasons Supergirl Has Lost Its Way (And 2 Ways It Can Find It Again) - Heroic Hollywood  Supergirl Season 2: The Curious Case of James Olsenâ€™s Absence - Hypable  Supergirl: How James Olsen Has Been Wronged - The Young Folks   bruh tv guide tvâ€¦. guide the most mainstream
column2: legitimate tv review source is saying this shit so â€œItâ€™s better to think about this breakup as a result of a collection of violations rather than this particular one. Yes
column3: this was the biggest lie of them all but Kara has been dealing with a number of incidents when her trust has been abused. Mon-El
column4: while attempting to grow throughout this season
column5: is still basically a 15-year-old boy. He doesnâ€™t have the emotional wisdom to know what heâ€™s doing. His pelvis is like a dowsing rod and his brain is just trying to catch up. For the Mon-El fans
column6: Iâ€™m not trying to say heâ€™s only been using Kara for (alleged) S-E-X but his actions do follow that kind of newness to feeling that a lustful boy might have as his heart tries to outgrow his immaturity. He doesnâ€™t know what heâ€™s doing. I wouldnâ€™t say thatâ€™s acceptable for a boy but itâ€™s conventional. For a man to still be exposing women to these kinds of growing pains is a kind of abuse with which Kara should not put up.â€  IT GETS BETTER â€œThe fount from which Kara draws most of her desire for Mon-El is that of another ever-present Kryptonian trait: loneliness. Kara had basically rejected Mon-El for most of the season thus far until she found herself alone again: Winn (Jeremy Jordan) and James (Mehcad Brooks) were vigilante-ing around National City
column7: Alex (Chyler Leigh) has been shifting her Danvers Sisters conversations to Maggie (Floriana Lima)
column8: and J'onn (David Harewood) is his own aloof and distant pit of despair. Mon-El honestly liked her and wanted to puppy-dog around her
column9: just nip at her ankles until she finally picked him up. And so she did.â€  yo just fyi i made a thread with all this on twitter and tagged the writers
column10: producers and network rightÂ here so RT if to draw their attention to this or just spread itÂ  " False text

popculty 160389823289 "2017-05-07 02:30:18 GMT" http://popculty.tumblr.com/post/160389823289/gailsimone-free-comic-book-day-you-guys-this "gailsimone:  FREE COMIC BOOK DAY
column2: YOU GUYS! This is something I remind people of every years
column3: so forgive me if you have heard me say this stuff before. But this past few months have been a bit hard on even some of the BEST comic book retailers
column4: so please take a moment and check this message out
column5: okay? Â Letâ€™s help them make 2017 an amazing year so they can keep bringing us wonderful nerd junk all year long.  AHEM! Free Comic Book Day on Saturday! I know I say this every year
column6: but a lot of people believe that the comics the comic shops give away are given free to retailers.They are not. Retailers have to pay for the books. They pay a reduced fee
column7: but they still pay for them. They also have to pay shipping. They have to pay for ads and they have to usually pay for extra employees
column8: and many shops pay to have guests or other special events. It can end up being a huge expense
column9: and even though a lot of new readers might come by
column10: part of it is also a celebration of comics
column11: and a lovely little bonus for the shopâ€™s loyal customers. Itâ€™s a great deal of effort
column14: with many retailers working TONS of extra hours just to make the day great for you. What I would ask everyone to do is
column15: when you go to get your free comics
column16: please take a little bit of extra time
column18: to shop in the store. Try a couple new comics off the rack or a new trade collection you have been thinking about. Maybe if you buy Magic cards or game supplies somewhere else
column20: think about buying some at the hosting store while you are there. It will add up and make their Free Comic Book Day much more successful and everyone will be happy
column21: and itâ€™s a nice way to say thank you. Â It helps if you buy ON THE DAY of Free Comic Book Day
column22: so that they know it makes a difference and they continue to participate.  Just a thought
column23: but when picking up your free comics
column24: please send a little bit of shopping love to the store that is putting on the event for you. Do it ON Free Comic Book Day so that they know the day is a success and that all their expense and effort is appreciated.Your comic store will love you and I will love you! " False text

column1: popculty 159614620623 "2017-04-15 21:34:51 GMT" http://popculty.tumblr.com/post/159614620623/cooking-with-queen-sugar-a-dish-to-be-savored "â€œAt first
column2: the experience of watching Queen Sugar
column3: which just  finished its first season on Oprahâ€™s OWN network
column4: is pleasantly  disorienting. As the opening credits roll
column5: with Meshell Ndegeocelloâ€™s  deep moody voice chanting in the background
column6: a kaleidoscope of  crystalline shapes shift
column8: forming a Rorschach test  of associations. Is that crack Iâ€™m looking at? Heroin? A burning blunt?   No
column9: itâ€™s sugar. I am forced to think about the ways that I have come to  expect that an allâ€“Black show will almost certainly involve the illicit  drug trade
column10: my eyes trained and made jaded by popular culture. (As it  turns out the show does address the presence of drugs and prisons in  Black lives
column11: but in a way that neither demonizes nor glamorizes them.)  And this realization leads me to think about sugar
column14: if not more destructiveâ€”its historical links to slavery
column17: its stealthy appearance in almost every  processed food
column18: its link to epidemics in diabetes and heart disease
column19: rising in particular for people of color. Already itâ€™s clear that this  will be a show that asks me to question my expectations.â€" True link

popculty 158758550811 "2017-03-24 00:27:57 GMT" http://popculty.tumblr.com/post/158758550811/the-good-fight-how-tv-should-take-on-trump "glassceilingbreakers: When Trump tweets
column2: social media goes into a tizzy. The result is a renewed reflection of the power of language. In October
column4: it was not unprecedented to hear news anchors and pundits drop the word â€œpussyâ€ in reference to Trumpâ€™s leaked audio recording about his penchant for grabbing privates without permission. Republican strategist Ana Navarro uttered the word on CNN and was immediately admonished by political commentator Scottie Nell Hughes: â€œWill you please stop saying that word? My daughter is listening.â€ But Navarro rightfully balked. If a presidential candidate
column5: especially one who then went on to claim the presidency
column6: could gleefully talk about assaulting women on tape and brandish the word â€œpussyâ€ without repercussion
column7: then why should he be the only one allowed to wield language as a weapon? Language is often used as a means to oppress
column8: to define marginalized groups on the speakerâ€™s own terms. This is why the creation of oneâ€™s own dialect can be used as a reclamation of power. The Good Fight has created its own oppositional dialect
column9: and we would all do well to start chewing the fat." False link

column8: an  expert in reproducing classical camera styles. She designed (and  sometimes built) the lavishly detailed sets and the many vibrant  costumes (many of which she stitched herself). Her own paintings adorn  the sets
column9: and she wrote special music and songs and commissioned  musicians to perform them. Hers is a deeply artisanal
